page.title: 12CASTLE DONINGTON PWR STATION
page.content: CASTLE DONINGTON POWER STATION WAS BUILT IN I959. IT COST Â£3O MILLION AND AT THE TIME WAS THE BIGGEST IN WESTERN EUROPE. IT MADE A GREAT CONTRIBUTION TO THE PROVISION OF BRITAIN'S ELECTRICITY AS IT WAS VERY EFFICIENT AND PRODUCED MORE ELECTRICITY THAN ANY OTHER BRITISH POWER STATION FOR FOUR YEARS. IT IS A COAL-FIRED POWER STATION POSITIONED NEAR TO THE EAST MIDLANDS COALFIELDS AND ON THE BANKS OF THE RIVER TRENT. THE STATION HAS SIX IOOMW TURBO ALTERNATORS. IT IS NOW A TWO-SHIFTING STATION AND IS USED TO BOOST THE POWER SUPPLY AT TIMES OF HEAVY DEMAND. THE GENERATORS CAN BE SWITCHED ON WITHIN MINUTES OF A REQUEST FROM THE GRID CONTROL ENGINEERS. WHEN CONDUCTING OUR SURVEY THE CHILDREN FROM OUR VILLAGE SCHOOL WERE WELCOMED BY POWER STATION STAFF AND TAKEN ON A CONDUCTED TOUR.
